metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8363 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
The jpeg2000_read_main_headers function in libavcodec/jpeg2000dec.c inFFmpeg before 2.6.5, 2.7.x before 2.7.3, and 2.8.x through 2.8.2 does notenforce uniqueness of the SIZ marker in a JPEG 2000 image, which allowsremote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds heap-memoryaccess) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted image withtwo or more of these markers.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8363` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:2.8.3-1
libav-tools - 7:2.8.3-1
libavcodec-extra - 7:2.8.3-1
libavcodec-extra57 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavcodec57 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavdevice57 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavfilter-extra - 7:2.8.3-1
libavfilter-extra6 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavfilter6 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavformat57 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavresample3 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavutil55 - 7:2.8.3-1
libpostproc54 - 7:2.8.3-1
libswresample2 - 7:2.8.3-1
libswscale4 - 7:2.8.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:2.8.3-1').
